dialogues.text: Because youвЂ™re hurting me. and walks away. Uzi looks to Royal. UZzI Were you in prison?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Kind of. Minimum security. I got jacked by the IRS. Should we split?

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Call me Mr. Tenenbaum.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m kidding. Call me Pappy.

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: Royal yells across the cemetery to Richie and Margot. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Come on! lLetвЂ™s shag ass!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Margot and Richie walking toward the cemetery gates.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: How are you and Raleigh getting along? You think youвЂ™re going to get back together?

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (pause) I donвЂ™t know.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Well, if you need someone to talk to, let me know, OK? I like Raleigh very much. I know heвЂ™s a lot older than you are, and youвЂ™re having some problems, but -- Anyway, maybe I can help.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: OK. Thanks. A maintenance man with a shovel in his hand yells from ac the cemetery:

dialogues.speaker: MAINTENANCE MAN
dialogues.text: Hey, Baumer! All right! Richie smiles and waves to the maintenance man.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: By the way, I heard about that letter you sent to Eli. Silence. Richie starts to say something. He hesitates. A pack of cigarettes falls out of MargotвЂ™s pocket on to t ground. They stop walking and look at it.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: You dropped some cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Those arenвЂ™t mine.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Well, they just fell out of your pocket. Margot picks up the pack of cigarettes and puts it back i her pocket.  53. INT. ELI CASHвЂ™S TOWNHOUSE. DAY. Eli walks into the vestibule smoking a joint which he kee in his mouth at all times like a cigarette. He opens the front door. Richie stands on the top step.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Oh, my Lord. Look at you. Eli embraces Richie. They smile sadly at each other.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Richie and Eli walking into the front room of the house. is furnished like a house in the English countryside, wit antiques and potted flowers and old rugs.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Did you tell Margot about that letter I wrote you?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Why? Did she mention it? Richie does not respond. ELI (CONTвЂ™D) Yes, I did.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Eli, that was meant to be just between you and me.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I know. IвЂ™m sorry. Why would she have repeated that, I wonder?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Well, I would ask you the same question.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (pause) Rightly so. INT. STUDIO. DAY. Richie and Eli walk into the next room. EliвЂ™s wife, Sab is painting in her studio. She is very beautiful and wear spectacles and a white sari. She is barefoot. Classical music plays quietly on the record player.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Sabrina? Sabrina does not look up. She seems irritated. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SABRINA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Look what I found on the doorstep. Sabrina looks to Richie. She is only mildly surprised. Sh has an English accent.

dialogues.speaker: SABRINA
dialogues.text: Hello, darling. Sabrina hugs and kisses Richie.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Charlotte? Stetson? Say hello to Uncle Richie. There are two children in the corner. Stetson is six. He works at a spinning potterвЂ™s wheel, molding a hunk of c Charlotte is five. She is painting a set of teacups. She has a cast in a sling on her arm. They are both blond and fair. The children do not respond to Eli. Eli does not appear t notice this, as he is in the process of relighting his jo

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: HowвЂ™d she break her arm?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (sadly) I fell down the stairs with her. Richie looks disturbed. He notices a nude, teenaged girl standing on the table. She has a deep tan, except where s wore a bikini. She is SabrinaвЂ™s model, Cinnamon. ELI (CONTвЂ™D) ThatвЂ™s Cinnamon. Hello, Cinnamon. Cinnamon looks at Eli coldly. INT. ELIвЂ™S STUDY. DAY. Eli sits on a couch across from Richie. They are both drinking wine. There is a large zip-lock bag of marijuana the table. There is a large, frightening painting on the wall of five men wearing African masks and sitting on dir bikes. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™d you say? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (pause) Hm?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I didnвЂ™t say anything.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: When? Right now? (pause) IвЂ™m sorry. DonвЂ™t listen to me. (barely audible) IвЂ™m on mescaline. IвЂ™ve been spaced out all day. Eli pours himself another glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Did you say youвЂ™re on mescaline?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (nods) I did, indeed. Very much so. Richie reflects on this for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: How often do you --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m worried about you, Richie.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (pause) Why?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Well, actually, Margot is, for some reason. But I did find it odd when you said you were in love with her. (pause) SheвЂ™s married, you know.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: And sheвЂ™s your sister.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (quickly) Adopted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Page 112 of The Royal Tenenbaums. It says вЂњChapter Five EXT. LINDBERGH PALACE HOTEL. DAY. The side entrance of the hotel. Royal goes in through revolving doors. INT. LOBBY. DAY. Royal comes into the lobby and freezes. A large number of trunks, suitcases and boxes are stacked piled on four carts next to the front desk. There are als several dozen hanging garments on a rack with wheels on i A bellboy rolls a fifth cart next to the others. The mana and his assistant come over and watch Royal study his possessions. Royal says suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: WhereвЂ™ re my encyclopedias?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: TheyвЂ™ ve been placed in storage.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Damn you. YouвЂ™re taking my encyclopedias. This is humiliating.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry. Would you like to --

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Where am I supposed to go? YouвЂ™re turning me into a goddamn hobo.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: IвЂ™d be happy to make a reservation for you at another hotel.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Frederick? The manager looks to the bellboy. The bellboy begins to r one of the carts across the lobby. The manager walks away Dusty, the elevator operator, appears at RoyalвЂ™s side.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Hello, Dusty.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Hello, sir. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Spot me a quarter, will you?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Of course. INT. TELEPHONE BOOTH. DAY. Royal places a call from the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Richie? ItвЂ™s your dad. INT. DINING ROOM. NIGHT. Etheline, Henry, Chas, Margot, Richie, Ari and Uzi sit at table eating dessert.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I think heвЂ™s very lonely. lLonelier than he lets on, and maybe lonelier than he even realizes.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Have you spoken to him about this?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Briefly. And he agreed that --

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry. Maybe IвЂ™m a little confused. What are you suggesting?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: That he come here and stay in my room.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (sincerely) No, IвЂ™m not. Anyway, I think heвЂ™d be much more comfortable here than --

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Who gives a shit?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: You poor sucker. You poor, washed-up poppaвЂ™s boy. Henry puts his hand gently on ChasвЂ™ arm. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: All right. LetвЂ™s not get out of hand. Chas jerks his arm away.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t get in the middle of this, Mr. Sherman. This is a family matter.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t talk to him like that.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Please, call me Henry.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: I prefer Mr. Sherman.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Call him Henry.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Why? I donвЂ™t know him that well.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™ve known him for ten years.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: As your accountant, Mr. Sherman, yes.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: (to Richie) Where are you going to sleep?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™11l just camp out upstairs. UZzI We brought an extra sleeping bag you can use.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Oh, thatвЂ™s OK. IвЂ™ve got an old Scout cot and a couple of army blankets. UZzI You want to borrow our electric --

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Uzi.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: We donвЂ™t mind, Dad. We like him. UZzI Who? Pappy? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Chas looks shocked and then revolted.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s not your decision, goddammit.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Nor is it yours.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Well, heвЂ™s already up there. Silence. RICHIE (CONTвЂ™D) I think heвЂ™s asleep, because of the medication heвЂ™s on. But I guess you can wake him up and throw him out, if Mom says itвЂ™s OK. INT. RICHIEвЂ™S BEDROOM. NIGHT. RichieвЂ™s room has been converted into a makeshift hospi room. Royal lies on an electric hospital bed. He has an I in his arm and a tube in his nose. There are several monitors and machines breathing and humming. There are numerous bottles of pills and medicines on the night stan Pagoda has on a surgical mask and scrubs. Chas stands in the doorway. Richie is behind him.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: All right. Let me just collect my things. Royal sits up on the edge of the bed. He is dressed in pi surgical scrubs. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) Would you mind handing me my cane, Richie? Richie hands Royal his cane. Royal struggles to his feet. He rolls the IV stand beside him. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) LetвЂ™s see, now. WhereвЂ™s my suitcase? RoyalвЂ™s knee gives out. He staggers a step. He grips th back of a chair and looks to Richie with a surprised expression. He collapses on to the floor. He produces a wooden spoon, which he takes between his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Dad? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Richie and Pagoda rush over and kneel on the floor beside Royal. Chas frowns. Richie yells out the door: RICHIE (CONTвЂ™D) Mom!

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Grab me a Nembutal, son. Richie runs to the night stand and pops open a bottle of pills. Chas looks down at Royal.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Are you OK? Royal takes the spoon out of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Fuck do you care? Richie gives Royal a pill with a glass of water. Etheline comes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Oh, my goodness!

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Pagoda. Call Dr. McClure.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Forty-five minutes later. Royal is back in bed. He is bei examined by Dusty, the elevator operator from the Lindber Palace. Dusty is dressed in a white lab coat and elevator operator pants with a red stripe down the side. He checks RoyalвЂ™s pulse while everyone watches. INT. HALLWAY. NIGHT. Dusty speaks with the Tenenbaums in the hallway outside RichieвЂ™s bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: His condition is stable. The attack was just a side-effect. I recommend that you push fluids and continue the stomach cancer medication. DustyвЂ™s beeper goes off. He looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DustyвЂ™s beeper has a digital message on it: вЂњSmitty w double yesterday. Can you sub for him tonight?вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dusty pushing a button on his beeper.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Can we move him?

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™1l have to wait and see.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Is he going to be all right?

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: That depends. Is he a fighter?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: (solemnly) Then thatвЂ™s the best weвЂ™ve got. Now, if youвЂ™1l1 excuse me, I have another call to make. INT. RICHIEвЂ™S BEDROOM. NIGHT. Etheline sits next to RoyalвЂ™s bed. Pagoda comes in and Royal a small brown paper sack.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Pagoda is in possession of a parcel that contains my will and some instructions regarding the funeral, including my epitaph, for when the time comes. Etheline nods. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) Proof-read it for me before they carve it on the headstone, OK?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I never did stop loving you, by the way. Do you believe that?

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Not really. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: You look terrific. That dress is stunning.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: (pause) Thanks. Royal raises an eyebrow. Etheline shakes her head and goe out of the room. Royal opens the paper sack and withdraws cheeseburger wrapped in aluminum foil. He unwraps it and takes a bite. He hesitates. Henry is standing in the doorway. He walks away. A dalmation mouse eats some crumbs off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: An hour later. Royal lies in bed, drinking a milkshake, reading a spy novel. Chas appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Lights out, old man. Chas turns out the light.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I was going to read for a little bit, Chas.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Sorry. 11:30. Lights out.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m in the middle of a sentence.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Have to finish it up in the morning. ThemвЂ™s the rules. Silence. Royal says in a quiet, strangely upbeat voice in the darkness:

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Goodnight, mвЂ™boy. Chas hesitates. He closes the door. INT. BALLROOM. NIGHT. The ballroom on the top floor of the house. There are cha and tables with sheets over them lined up along the walls Near the center of the room, there is a yellow nylon pup- tent. The room is dark except for a lamp glowing inside t tent.  63. INT. TENT. NIGHT. There is a Boy Scout sleeping bag on an air mattress on a inside the tent. There is a photograph of the Tenenbaum family taped to the nylon wall. There is a small table wi a stack of books and some of RichieвЂ™s Matchbox cars and tennis trophies on it. Richie lies on the cot reading Thr Plays by Margot Tenenbaum. Chas comes into the tent. Richie looks up, startled.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Looks like you and Dad are back together again, huh?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (pause) HeвЂ™s your dad, too, Chas.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: No, heвЂ™s not. (pause) You really hate me, donвЂ™t you?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (puzzled) No, I donвЂ™t. I love you. Chas looks disturbed by this.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Well, I donвЂ™t know what you think youвЂ™re going to get out of this. But believe me, whatever it is, itвЂ™s not worth it.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t want to hurt you, Chas. I know what you and the boys have been through. YouвЂ™re my brother, and I love you.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: (gritting his teeth) Stop saying that. EXT. RICHIEвЂ™S BEDROOM. DAY. The next morning. Royal sits on the window sill smoking a cigarette. Pagoda sits next to him drinking a cup of coff Royal throws his cigarette out the window. He looks down the street. He frowns. Eli is climbing out a window on the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s that jackass doing here? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pagoda looks down at Eli. Eli drops to the sidewalk. He sees RoyalвЂ™s cigarette burning on the ground. He steps it. He looks up to Royal. Their eyes meet. Royal yells: ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) I know you, asshole! Eli hesitates. He smiles defiantly. He runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An article on Eli in the Sunday magazine section. The headline says вЂњWhere the Wild Things Are.вЂќ There is a photograph of Eli in the desert holding a dead rattlesnak the tail in each hand. A note stapled to the top says: вЂ Mrs. Tenenbaum, Just in case you missed it. Love, Eli.вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Margot and Etheline sitting together in EthelineвЂ™s stud Margot is reading HenryвЂ™s book, Accounting for Everythi Etheline is reading the article on Eli. Margot looks at i

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Did Eli send you that?

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: (nods) He always sends me his clippings.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (incredulous) What for?

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: I think he just likes the encouragement. HeвЂ™s done it for years. He used to send me his grades in college.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (frowns) ThatвЂ™s ridiculous. There is a rap on the glass. Margot and Etheline look up. Raleigh is standing in the window. He looks miserable. EXT. GARDEN. DAY. The backyard. Margot and Raleigh sit at a metal table drinking tea.

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: How long do you intend to stay here?

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: Are you ever coming home?

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (pause) Maybe not. But --

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re joking.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: No. But --

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: I want to die. Raleigh crumples into a ball on the ground and stays ther Margot puts her hand on his back.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Raleigh, please. For GodвЂ™s sake. Raleigh sits up suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: Have you met someone else?

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (pause) I couldnвЂ™t begin to even think about knowing how to answer that question. Raleigh stands up and walks away. INT. HALLWAY. DAY. Royal watches down the stairwell as Margot comes up. He knocks on the railing. She looks up at him. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t like the way youвЂ™re treating Raleigh.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You donвЂ™t even know him.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve met him. And I donвЂ™t think he deserves --

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Stay out of it. Margot walks toward her room. Royal steps on to the landi at the top of the stairs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™ re two-timing him with that bloodsucker Eli Cash. Margot stops. She stands still with her back to Royal. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) ItвЂ™s not right, dammit. You used to be a genius. Margot turns to Royal. They look at each other for a long minute. She says in a quiet voice:

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: No, I didnвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Well, anyway, thatвЂ™s what they used to say. Margot goes into her room and closes the door. EXT. ROOF. DAY. Raleigh stands at the edge of the roof looking down to th ground while Richie cleans the empty falconвЂ™s coop.

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: Richard, I know youвЂ™re terribly close to Margot, and perhaps you understand her better than anyone else.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: Nevertheless, may I confide in you?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (pause) OK.

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: I believe sheвЂ™s having an affair. Silence. Richie comes out of the coop and goes over to Raleigh. RALEIGH (CONTвЂ™D) IвЂ™m utterly devastated. I donвЂ™t know where else to turn. Will you advise me?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know. What do you want to do? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: Well, I thought, perhaps --

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Find the guy and get him?

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: (pause) Well, no. I thought we might -- Richie punches his hand through the attic window. He kick it. Raleigh looks shocked. He stares at RichieвЂ™s bloody hand.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Who do you think it might be?

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: (hesitates) I donвЂ™t know, at the moment. INT. CHASвЂ™ BEDROOM. DAY. Royal comes down the hallway and looks in the doorway to ChasвЂ™ room. There are five computers, four telephones, Xerox machine and a television and VCR on a cart. Three secretaries make copies and take messages. Chas is on the telephone. A messenger waits for him to sign a document. Ari and Uzi sit working with a calculator and a ledger pa a small desk in the corner. Royal says to them:

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s go down to Little Tokyo and get some firecrackers. Chas covers the receiver with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Nothing. You got them crunching numbers for you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Please, donвЂ™t come in this room. INT. ETHELINEвЂ™S STUDY. DAY. Etheline sits at her desk writing numbers on little bits pottery and recording it in a notebook. Royal stands in t garden, looking in the window. His IV bag hangs on a roll stand beside him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: ChassieвЂ™s got those boys cooped up like a pair of jackrabbits, Ethel.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: He has his reasons.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I know it. But you canвЂ™t raise boys to be scared of life. You got to brew some recklessness into them.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: I think thatвЂ™s terrible advice.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (pause) No, you donвЂ™t. INT. RICHIEвЂ™S BEDROOM. DAY. Royal listens to Ari over the intercom while Pagoda does exercises in the corner:

dialogues.speaker: ARI, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We take boxing and self-defense class. Royal pushes a button to talk.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not talking about dance lessons. IвЂ™m talking about putting a brick through the other guyвЂ™s windshield. IвЂ™m talking about taking it out and chopping it up. Silence. Ari says over the intercom:

dialogues.speaker: ARI, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Royal, Ari and Uzi laugh continuously throughout the following montage.) Royal, Ari and Uzi jump off a high scaffold into the indo pool at the 375th Street Y. Royal, Ari and Uzi jaywalk through heavy traffic. Royal, Ari and Uzi ride horses in the park. Royal leads t at a full gallop down a ravine and over a stone wall. Royal, Ari and Uzi race go-carts up and down loading ramp and in between fork-lifts in a large warehouse. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Royal, Ari and Uzi throw water balloons at a gypsy cab. Royal, Ari and Uzi hide cartons of chocolate milk under t jackets and walk quickly out the door of a bodega. Royal, Ari and Uzi ride on the back of a speeding garbage truck. EXT. STREET. DAY.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (indicating Pagoda) He saved my life, you know. Thirty years ago. I was knifed at a bazaar in Calcutta, and he carried me to the hospital on his back.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: Who stabbed you? Royal motions to Pagoda again.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: He did. There was a price on my head, and he was a hired assassin. Stuck me in the gut with a shiv. INT. CHASвЂ™ BEDROOM. DAY. The three secretaries are still at work, and Chas is on t telephone. He sees Royal, Ari and Uzi walking by the hallway. Chas hangs up the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: WhereвЂ™ve you been? Chas goes to the doorway. He glares at Ari, Uzi and Royal

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Just stepped out to get some air. HowвЂ™s the --

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: (concerned) WhatвЂ™s that? Chas points to a spot of dried blood on UziвЂ™s forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Holy shit. ThatвЂ™s not -- What is that? Royal licks his finger and rubs away the blood. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) No. ThatвЂ™s dogвЂ™s blood. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Chas frowns. He looks to Royal. Royal hesitates. Chas grabs Royal by the arm and pulls him into the closet acro the hall. INT. CLOSET. DAY. Chas closes the door and turns on the light. There are hundreds of board games, most of which are about thirty y old, in shelves up to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Stay away from my children. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (looking around) My God. I havenвЂ™t been in here in years.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: (screams) Are you listening to me?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Yes, I am. And I think youвЂ™re having a nervous breakdown. I donвЂ™t believe youвЂ™ve recovered from RachaelвЂ™s death. I think -- Chas turns off the light, goes out of the closet, and clo the door. Royal stands alone in the dark. He switches the light back on and looks down at the floor. He smiles. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) There you are. The stuffed boarвЂ™s head is under the bottom shelf, in t corner, covered with dust. EXT. PARK. DAY. Royal and Etheline walk along a path through the park. Ro rolls his hanging IV bag at his side.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Oh, IвЂ™m having a ball. Scrapping and yelling. Mixing it up. Loving every minute with this damn crew. (sincerely) IвЂ™d like to thank you for raising our children, by the way. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: (pause) OK.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not kidding. Etheline shrugs. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) You always put them first, didnвЂ™t you?

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: I tried to. Lately, I feel like maybe I didnвЂ™t do such a great job.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Goddammit, donвЂ™t do that to yourself. IвЂ™m the one who failed them. Or, anyway, itвЂ™s nobodyвЂ™s fault. (pause) Plus, it doesnвЂ™t --

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Well, then why didnвЂ™t you give a damn about us, Royal? Why didnвЂ™t you care?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know, but IвЂ™m ashamed of myself. IвЂ™11 tell you one thing, though. YouвЂ™ve got more grit, and fire, and guts than any bob-tailed fox I ever damn hunted, and if -- Etheline laughs. Royal smiles. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) What? WhatвЂ™s so funny?

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: No, tell me.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just these little expressions of yours.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (pause) I donвЂ™t know what youвЂ™re talking about. But IвЂ™1l1 take it as a compliment. They look at each other for a long minute. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) YouвЂ™re true blue, Ethel. You really are.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Henry with two bags of groceries in his arms, watching fr behind a stone wall above the path. He listens as Royal says: ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) HowвЂ™s your love life?

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: None of your business. Henry frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 147 of The Royal Tenenbaums. It says вЂњChapter Six. EXT. SIDEWALK. EVENING. Etheline and Henry come down the front steps of the Tenen house. Henry is dressed in black tie. The ends of a pair theatre tickets stick out of his breast pocket. Pagoda ho a gypsy cab for them at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: IвЂ™d like you to talk to Royal about us, if you donвЂ™t mind.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: (hesitates) I donвЂ™t think the timingвЂ™s right for that, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Well, IвЂ™d agree if I thought he was really going to die in six weeks. But I donвЂ™t. Etheline stops at the bottom of the steps. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Well, I hope youвЂ™re right. (pause) Actually, I donвЂ™t believe IвЂ™m going to join you tonight. I/вЂ™11 call you in the morning. Etheline turns around and goes back up the steps. Henry watches her. He looks sad and stunned. Pagoda watches Henry. Etheline goes inside and closes the door.  73. INT. CLOSET. NIGHT. Royal and Pagoda stand together in the board-game-filled closet drinking Martinis and smoking cigarettes. Royal ha half-eaten cheeseburger in his hand. He whispers excitedl

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: She said that? Pagoda nods. Royal snaps his fingers. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) We got the sucker on the ropes. INT. KITCHEN. DAY. The next morning. Henry stands at the counter reading the Wall Street Journal. He has on reading glasses. Royal com into the kitchen eating a cheeseburger. Henry looks at hi blankly. Royal sits on a stool.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (pause) OK.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Are you trying to steal my woman?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (pause) I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: You heard me, Coltrane.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (long pause) Coltrane?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Did you just call me Coltrane?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You didnвЂ™t?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: No. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (pause) OK.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: But if I did? Henry waits for Royal to continue. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) You wouldnвЂ™t be able to do anything about it, would you?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t think so?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: No, I donвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (seething) Listen, Royal. If you think --

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: You want to talk some jive? Henry hesitates. He looks puzzled. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) IвЂ™11 talk some jive with you. Royal stands up. He screams: ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) IвЂ™11 talk some jive like you never heard!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (yelling) Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Right on!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Sit down!

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: What? Royal starts doing a little dance in front of Henry. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) WhatвЂ™d you say?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I said, sit down, goddammit! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Oh, I heard you. Henry jumps to his feet. Royal stops dancing. He says darkly: ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) I want you out of my house.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: This is not your house.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t play semantics with me. I want your raggedy ass back on the --

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s going on here? Henry and Royal look to Etheline. She stands in the doorw

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Nothing. Royal goes to the refrigerator and opens it. He takes out jar of peanut butter and a jar of grape jelly. Etheline looks to Henry. Henry walks out of the room. INT. RICHIEвЂ™S BEDROOM. DAY. Henry goes into RichieвЂ™s room and takes a bottle of Roy pills off the night stand. He goes back out of the room. INT. TELEPHONE ROOM. DAY. Henry reads the label on the bottle while he places a cal

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Hello. IвЂ™m calling in regards to a Dr. McClure. Yes. At Colby General. The name of the patient is Royal Tenenbaum. Henry takes out a pill and examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pill. It has pink and blue sparkles all over it and t word вЂњTic-TacвЂќ printed on the side. INT. STAIRWAY. DAY. Henry goes up the stairs with a cold, determined look on face. He has the bottle of pills in his hand.  76. INT. PAGODAвЂ™S ROOM. DAY. A small room with an Indian pattern on the wallpaper. Pag lies on a hammock listening to Indian music on a portable record player. There is a knock on the door, and then it opens. Henry stands in the doorway. He stares at Pagoda.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: How much is he paying you? Pagoda looks scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A television set tuned in to an interview show. The host a tall, distinguished-looking man in his fifties. He is Peter Bradley. Eli is his guest. They sit at a round tabl lit at the center of a pitch-black room.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Well, I grew up with the Tenenbaum family, you know.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Right. TheyвЂ™ve come on hard times now, havenвЂ™t they? Eli nods sadly.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: RichieвЂ™s room. Margot and Royal are watching Eli on television.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Change it. The door opens. Richie comes into the room. His hand is wrapped with bloody bandages. Margot looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™d you do to your hand?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Nothing. Richie goes into the closet. Two dalmation mice dart out across the floor. They run under the radiator. Royal frowns.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: You think we could get somebody to come over here and kill some of these mice for us? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: No. Those belong to Chas. Or, anyway, he invented them. Richie drags a large trunk out of the closet.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Well, tell him to stick them in a fucking cage or something. Henry goes over to the Henry and Pagoda come into the room. intercom and presses a button on it.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Etheline? Would you mind coming up here for a minute, please? Royal looks at Henry suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s cooking, Pops?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™1l see.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (on the intercom) OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EliвЂ™s interview continues. The television set.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Now, your previous novel --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: WildcattinвЂ™.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Not a success. Why? Right.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Hm. Well, WildcattinвЂ™ was written ina kind of obsolete vernacular, much like the -- He looks quickly across the room. Eli freezes. ELI (CONTвЂ™D) Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (looking around) What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A look of sheer horror crosses EliвЂ™s face. He braces hi against the edge of the table. Peter looks concerned. PETER (CONTвЂ™D) Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (concerned) Why is it so dense in here? Peter hesitates. Eli removes his microphone, stands up, a walks off the set. Peter Bradley watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Everyone watching in RichieвЂ™s bedroom. They look stunne

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. What the hell kind of way to act is that?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (pause) HeвЂ™s on drugs.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (worried) IвЂ™1l be right back. Margot goes to the telephone. Etheline and Chas come into the room. Chas is eating a sandwich. Ari, Uzi and Buckley follow them.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Hold on a minute, please. Henry steps in front of the television set and turns it o HENRY (CONTвЂ™D) Pagoda has something to say. Everyone looks to Pagoda. Silence. Pagoda looks worried. He turns to Royal and points at him.

dialogues.speaker: PAGODA
dialogues.text: He has the cancer.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (angrily) No, he doesnвЂ™t. Royal sits up. Henry stares at Royal. HENRY (CONTвЂ™D) I know what stomach cancer looks like. IвЂ™ve seen it. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HENRY (CONTвЂ™D) And you donвЂ™t eat three cheeseburgers a day with french fries when youвЂ™ve got it. The pain is excruciating.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: How would you know?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: My wife had it. Silence. Royal pulls out his IV and the other tubes that attached to him. He goes into the bathroom and closes the door. Henry turns to Etheline. HENRY (CONTвЂ™D) Not only is there no Dr. McClure at Colby General, thereвЂ™s no Colby General. It closed in 1974. Chas crushes his sandwich in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: PAGODA
dialogues.text: Ah, shit, man.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: But why would he -- Chas slams his hand against the bathroom door as hard as can. He sits down on the bed and picks up the phone. He places a call.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Yes. Can you send a taxi to 111 Archer Avenue? Right away, please. Thank you. Chas hangs up. Royal comes out of the bathroom. He is ful dressed in a suit, and he is zipping up a small leather b He picks up one of his bottles of pills off the night sta and leaves the rest. He looks to Pagoda.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I guess weвЂ™re back on the street, pal. Etheline looks to Pagoda. She frowns. Pagoda looks uneasy

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Were you part of this?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Of course he was. Etheline looks to Royal. Royal looks to Pagoda. He says regretfully:

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Time to come clean. No more lies. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pagoda stares at Royal bitterly. Richie points at the hospital bed and life-support machines.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: HowвЂ™d you get all these medical supplies?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (pause) A guy at St. PeteвЂ™s owed me a favor. I did some malpractice work for him. I do have high blood pressure, though. Royal swallows one of his pills. He turns and stands in front of everyone. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) Look. I know IвЂ™m the bad guy on this one, but I just want to say that the last six days have been the best six days of, probably, my whole life. A strange, sad expression crosses RoyalвЂ™s face.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Immediately after making this statement, Royal realized that it was true. Royal begins to gather his possessions. INT. HALLWAY. DAY. Royal comes out of RichieвЂ™s room with his suitcases. Etheline stands at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: WhyвЂ™d you do this to us, Royal? Royal stops. ETHELINE (CONTвЂ™D) What was the point?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (pause) I thought maybe I could win you back. Or, anyway, I thought I could get rid of Henry and keep things status quo.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: But we hadnвЂ™t spoken in seven years.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I know. Plus, I was broke, and I got kicked out of my hotel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: (pause) YouвЂ™re a bastard. Royal nods. Etheline stares at him angrily, with tears in her eyes. ETHELINE (CONTвЂ™D) Goodbye, Royal. Royal turns and walks down the stairs. INT. STAIRWELL. DAY. Chas stands at the bottom of the stairs and watches Royal come down with his suitcases. Royal stops in front of him

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Take it easy on those boys, Chassie. I donвЂ™t want this to happen to you. Chas hesitates. Royal walks past him and goes out the fro door. EXT. STREET. DAY. Richie and Royal stand on the sidewalk. RoyalвЂ™s suitcas are beside him. Margot and Henry stand at the top of the steps, in the front doorway.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: You know, Richie, this illness, this closeness to death. ItвЂ™s been very profound for me. I feel like a different person. I really do.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Dad. You were never dying.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (smiles) But IвЂ™m going to live. Richie shakes his head. He turns away and goes up the ste past Margot and Henry, into the house. Royal and Margot l at each other. Royal points to Henry. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) HeвЂ™s not your father.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (pause) Neither are you. Margot closes the door. Royal puts his hands in his pocke He stares into space. He begins to cry. A gypsy cab pulls over to the curb. Royal waves to the driver. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The front door of the house opens. Pagoda comes down the steps with two suitcases. He looks furious.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: How you doing, pal? Pagoda drops his suitcases to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: PAGODA
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch. PagodaвЂ™s teeth flash as he goes over to Royal and stabs with a penknife. Royal screams. He clutches his side. He falls on the ground. The gypsy cab driver watches blankly

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Goddammit! ThatвЂ™s the last time I get knifed by you! You hear me? Pagoda helps Royal to his feet. He collects his suitcases Royal leans on Pagoda as they get into the gypsy cab. Roy says to the driver: ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) The 375th Street Y, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 198 of The Royal Tenenbaums. It says вЂњChapter Seve EXT. 375TH STREET Y. DAY. A huge building that looks like a castle. A sign next to door says вЂњ375th Street Y.вЂќ INT. 375TH STREET Y. DAY. An extremely small room with a low ceiling and a single b Royal stands in front of a mirror while Pagoda stitches u the knife-wound in his side. He holds a bottle of iodine one hand and a box of bandages in the other.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: EveryoneвЂ™s against me.

dialogues.speaker: PAGODA
dialogues.text: You canвЂ™t blame them, man.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I know. But, dammit, I want to be loved by this family. Pagoda pours some iodine on a cotton ball and applies it RoyalвЂ™s knife wound. Royal grimaces. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) How much money you got? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PAGODA
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t have.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (frowns) What do you mean? YouвЂ™re broke? Pagoda nods. Royal looks furious. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) You got to be kidding me. HowвЂ™re we supposed to pay for the damn room? Pagoda looks up at Royal coldly. Silence. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) All right. WeвЂ™1l figure something out. INT. HENRYвЂ™S APARTMENT. NIGHT. HenryвЂ™s bedroom is filled with paintings and sculptures the fifties and sixties. He puts on a slow jazz record an sits down across from Etheline at a small table with a va of roses, two bottles of wine, and three candles on it. Henry has on pale-blue silk pajamas. Etheline wears a cre silk nightgown. The doors to the balcony are open, and th is a gentle breeze. They look at each other fondly for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Would you like another glass of wine?

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Yes, please. Henry refills EthelineвЂ™s glass. He clinks his glass aga hers and takes a small sip. She drinks her whole glass al at once. Henry looks uneasy. Etheline says suddenly: ETHELINE (CONTвЂ™D) Maybe weвЂ™re rushing things, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (relieved) YouвЂ™re right. ItвЂ™s awkward sitting here in our pajamas and everything. We donвЂ™t have to do this right now. LetвЂ™s just try and have a nice time.

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: Henry gets up and changes the record to a more upbeat num (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes, I think weвЂ™re both a little uneasy, and thereвЂ™s no need for us to force anything. ThereвЂ™s no hurry. LetвЂ™s just

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Actually, I should go. Silence. Henry nods. He looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Can I, at least, offer you some dessert? Henry points to a dessert cart with a lemon meringue pie, cheesecakes, a bowl of strawberries, a chocolate mousse, a crepe suzette on it. Etheline hesitates. Henry quickly strikes a match and sets the crepe suzette on fire. His napkin catches on fire, and he dips it in his water glass He looks to Etheline.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: No, I think youвЂ™re right. I should go. Etheline picks up her overnight bag off a chair and goes the bathroom. Henry sits alone. He gets up and turns off the record player. EXT. BRIDGE. DAY. A footbridge over the river. Margot waits in the middle o the bridge. Eli walks towards her from the opposite bank. His face is smeared with dirt and traces of paint. His clothes look severely dishevelled. He stops a few feet aw from Margot.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not in love with you any more.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: I didnвЂ™t know you ever were.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s not make this any more difficult than it already is.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (pause) OK.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: OK, what?

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: OK, IвЂ™m not in love with you, either. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I know. YouвЂ™re in love with Richie. Which is sick and gross. Silence. Margot nods.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Do you send my mother your clippings? Eli hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And your grades in --

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Please, stop ridiculing me. Eli turns away and looks sadly out at the river. Margot g over and stands beside him. ELI (CONTвЂ™D) You never gave me the time of day until I started getting good reviews.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Your reviews arenвЂ™t that good.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: But the sales are.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A second bridge, two hundred yards away. A large man ina coat and tie takes photographs of Margot and Eli with a telephoto lens. INT. PRIVATE DETECTIVEвЂ™S OFFICE. DAY. A small room on the 30th floor of an office building. Raleigh, Richie and Dudley sit across a desk from the lar man in the coat and tie. He is a detective.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: How much do you already know, gentlemen?

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: Very little, I assure you.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Would you like to examine the report?

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: We would, rather. Yes. The detective hands Raleigh a manila folder. He opens and begins to read. Richie looks over his shoulder. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margot at age twelve buys a pack of cigarettes in a bodeg She smokes one on the roof of the house, leaning against chimney, next to the falconвЂ™s coop. (In each of the following images, Margot smokes a cigaret Margot climbs out the window of a girlsвЂ™ dormitory. She carries a small suitcase. She shimmies down the gutter an runs across the lawn. Margot stands inside a torch-lit shack among a group of dancing Rastafarians in Jamaica. She holds hands with one them while he lights a large brown-paper-wrapped marijuan cigarette. A man dressed in a black shirt with a priestвЂ collar places a string of shells around MargotвЂ™s neck. Another man has a small machine gun. There is a goat in t doorway, and the ocean glimmers outside. Margot opens a window and looks out at the Eifel Tower. S wears a bra and a slip. A topless girl appears next to he eating a croissant. The girl puts her arms around Margotв waist, and Margot runs her hands through the girlвЂ™s hai Margot stands in a pool of water facing a young tribesman New Guinea. He has on warpaint and wears a large tusk in nose. Margot kisses him on the mouth. Margot sits in a make-up chair at a television studio. Pe Bradley comes up behind her and puts his hands down her shirt. Margot smiles at him mischievously. Margot makes out with: - a Puerto Rican teenager in the back seat of a taxi; - a skinny guy with a Mohawk on a city bus; - a tough-looking Irishman on the deck of a ferry; - Eli in a deserted subway train going full speed at nigh

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Raleigh turning to the last page of the report. He closes the folder and looks to Richie. Richie looks stunned. Silence. RALEIGH (CONTвЂ™D) She smokes.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Yes.  87. INT. BASEMENT. DAY. Royal, Pagoda, Dusty and the manager of the hotel sit ata table in the laundry room of the Lindbergh Palace. The manager is reviewing a typewritten document.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: All right. Everything seems to be in order. IвЂ™11 contact you in the next twenty-four hours.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I appreciate that. Which way are you leaning, by the way?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: IвЂ™1l inform you of my decision at the appropriate time.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I get it. Put in a good word for us, Dusty.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: I already did. INT. RALEIGHвЂ™S LABORATORY. DAY. Raleigh lies face down on the couch with his head buried the cushions. Dudley walks over to him with a box of building blocks. He says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: You want to play some word games or do some experiments on me or anything? Raleigh answers without moving. His voice is muffled.

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: No. Richie walks by in a bathrobe. He carries a pair of scissors. He goes into the bathroom, closes the door, and locks it. INT. BATHROOM. DAY. Hot water runs full blast in the shower and the sink. Ric stands in front of the mirror. He holds a pair of scissor in his hand. He has clipped off his beard. He opens the medicine cabinet and takes out a can of shav cream and a straight razor. He covers his face with the shaving cream. He picks up the razor. He looks back in th mirror. He pushes his hand back through his hair, takes a deep breath, and says quietly: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m going to kill myself tomorrow. Silence. Richie slices the razor deeply, four times, alon his left forearm. Blood runs into the sink. He switches hands with the razor and slashes his other wrist. He sits down on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The bathroom door slamming open. Dudley bursts into the room. He looks horrified. The floor is flooded with water and blood. Richie is slumped in the corner with shaving cream all over his face. Dudley screams hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three paramedics race down a corridor pushing Richie on a gurney. Raleigh and Dudley run beside him. They are cover with blood. Etheline hangs up the telephone and runs into the hallway She throws open the closet door and grabs her coat. Chas, Ari and Uzi hold on as Anwar weaves the BMW in and of traffic. Buckley has his head out the window. Margot bursts through the doors of the emergency room. Sh looks around frantically. She sees Dudley. She sees blood on him. She rushes over and grabs his arms.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Where is he, Dudley?

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: (pause) Who? INT. HOSPITAL ROOM. DAY. Everyone is gathered around Richie in his hospital bed. H arms are covered with bandages. A doctor gives him an injection and says to Etheline:

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™1l probably sleep for several hours, and then IвЂ™11 come back to check on him. Etheline nods. She has tears all over her face. The docto leaves the room. Margot holds RichieвЂ™s hand.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: How do you feel? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Fine, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Are you in any pain?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: WhyвЂ™d you try to kill yourself?

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t press him right now.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I wrote a suicide note.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right after I regained consciousness. Everyone looks slightly confused.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Can we read it?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Could you paraphrase it for us?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t think so.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Is it dark?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Of course itвЂ™s dark. ItвЂ™s a suicide note.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: All right. ThatвЂ™s enough. The doctor said to let him sleep. INT. WAITING AREA. DAY. The corridor outside RichieвЂ™s room. Etheline fills out insurance forms. Ari and Uzi sit on ChasвЂ™ lap. Margot s next to Raleigh. Raleigh stares into space. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™ve made a cuckold of me. Everyone looks at Raleigh and Margot. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: Many times over.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: And youвЂ™ve nearly killed your poor brother.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: It doesnвЂ™t matter.

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s balling Eli Cash. Everyone looks surprised and extremely uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Oh, my goodness.

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: May I have a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: Shall I repeat the question?

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t smoke.

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: (bitterly) I bloody well know that. Raleigh stares at Margot in silence. Margot sighs. She reaches into her pocket and takes out a pack of cigarette She gives one to Raleigh. He puts it in his mouth. RALEIGH (CONTвЂ™D) And a light, please? Margot takes out some matches and lights RaleighвЂ™s ciga (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RALEIGH (CONTвЂ™D) Thank you. Raleigh stands up and walks away, down the hall, out the door. Silence. Margot lights a cigarette for herself. Etheline looks disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: How long have you been a smoker?

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (pause) Twenty-two years.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Well, I think you should quit. Margot nods. The door opens at the end of the hall. Henry Sherman come in. Etheline sees him and stands up. He goes over to her. He starts to put on his glasses. As he unfolds them, he unintentionally clamps them to his necktie and pulls his necktie up to his temple. He says earnestly:

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: How can I help? Etheline begins to point to HenryвЂ™s necktie suspended n his ear, but she hesitates. Henry senses something wrong his peripheral vision and looks confused. He swats at the necktie, hurling his glasses off his face and on to the floor. Henry picks up his glasses and puts them back on. He look to Etheline with an embarrassed expression. Etheline puts her arms around him. She hugs him tightly and starts to c EXT. STREET. NIGHT. Three hours later. A gypsy cab stops in front of the hospital. Royal and Pagoda get out and walk quickly into building. They are both dressed in hotel elevator-operato uniforms. INT. HOSPITAL. NIGHT. Royal speaks anxiously to a nurse at the registration des Pagoda stands behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Richie Tenenbaum, please.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Your name? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Royal Tenenbaum. The nurse looks down at her registration book. She frowns She looks back to Royal.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m afraid visiting hours are over, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Why? What does it say there? They donвЂ™t want me?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry. I have to refer you to Dr. Burroughs. HeвЂ™1l be in tomorrow afternoon. Silence. EXT. SIDEWALK. NIGHT. Royal and Pagoda stand in front of the hospital. Royal points to the edge of the roof. He sounds desperate.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I think if we shimmy up that gutter and jump across the window ledge we can pry open the ventilation shaft and --

dialogues.speaker: PAGODA
dialogues.text: There he is, man. Pagoda points to Richie waiting at the bus stop on the corner. He is dressed in surgical scrubs and bedroom slippers. His arms are covered with bandages. Royal looks puzzled. A bus pulls over in front of Richie. The doors open. Royal calls out:

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Richie? Richie looks to Royal and Pagoda. He sees their uniforms. He hesitates. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) WhereвЂ™ re you going? Silence. Richie gets on the bus. Royal and Pagoda watch i drive away. Royal looks very upset. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) I have to say, he didnвЂ™t look half bad for a suicide. Attempted suicide, anyway. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pagoda nods. He puts his arm around RoyalвЂ™s shoulder. INT. BUS. NIGHT. An old city busy with trash on the floor and graffiti spr painted on the walls. Richie sits in the back row and rid downtown. INT. BALLROOM. NIGHT. The ballroom on the top floor of the Tenenbaum house. Ric walks in and sees the lamp glowing inside his tent. Margo calls out from inside.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: WhoвЂ™s there? Richie does not respond.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello? Richie looks at the seventeen paintings of Margot hanging the corner. An unfinished eighteenth, with Margot slightl older, leans against the wall. Richie goes to the tent at the center of the room. INT. TENT. NIGHT. Richie looks into the tent. Margot is sitting on the floo next to a record player smoking a cigarette. She has a Rolling Stones record in her hand. She looks startled.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing in my tent?

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Just listening to some records. Margot puts out her cigarette. She seems worried.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought you were supposed to be in the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I checked myself out.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Well, shouldnвЂ™t you be on some kind of suicide watch or something?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (pause) Probably. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Richie goes into the tent and sits down Indian-style in f of Margot. Margot sighs. She puts on the Rolling Stones record. It plays quietly.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: How many stitches did you get?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know. You want to see? Margot nods. Richie unwraps one of his bandages. His arm covered with jagged, crisscrossing stitches and dried blo Margot looks stricken.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Jesus, Richie. That looks horrible. Richie nods. He wraps the bandage back around his arm.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I heard about your ex-husband.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (pause) Desmond?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (hesitates) I guess so. I didnвЂ™t get his name.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Yeah. I met him in the ocean. I was swimming, and he came out to me ina canoe. We were only married for nine days.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (nods) And I heard about Eli.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (sighs) I know. Poor Eli. Anyway, we mostly just talked about you.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (surprised) You did?

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess that was the attraction, if you know what I mean. Silence. Richie says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I have to tell you something. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s that?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (sadly) I love you, too. Richie kisses Margot on the mouth, and she kisses him bac She puts her hands on the back of his head. Richie pulls away from her and looks into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t stop thinking about you. I went away for a year, and it only got worse. I donвЂ™t know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: LetвЂ™s lie down for a minute. Richie lies down on the cot. Margot looks at his Boy Scou sleeping bag.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the one we took to the museum, isnвЂ™t it? Richie nods. Margot sighs. She lies down next to Richie a puts her arm around his shoulder. She smooths back his ha They listen to the music for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: WhyвЂ™d you do it? Because of me?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but itвЂ™s not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re not going to do it again, are you?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (pause) I doubt it. Margot nods. She starts crying. She kisses RichieвЂ™s han Richie looks worried. Margot gets up and goes out of the tent. Richie sits alone for a minute. Margot looks back into the tent.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: I think weвЂ™re just going to have to be secretly in love with each other and leave it at that, Richie. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They look at each other for a long minute. Richie nods. Margot turns away and goes out the tent. Richie picks up the stack of books off the table next to cot. The book on top is Family of Geniuses. Then there ar MargotвЂ™s books, RaleighвЂ™s book, HenryвЂ™s book and El He spreads them out on the floor among his Matchbox cars tennis trophies. A dalmation mouse appears and crawls amo them. The record ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 230 of The Royal Tenenbaums. It says вЂњChapter Eigh INT. HALLWAY. DAY. The next morning. Richie comes downstairs in his pajamas. He carries the stuffed boarвЂ™s head. He hangs it on the in its place. INT. ELEVATOR. DAY. The elevator at the Lindbergh Palace. Royal is dressed in his elevator-operator uniform. He takes three well-dresse businessmen down to the lobby. He looks exhausted and depressed. The doors open. One of the businessmen hands Royal a dollar as they walk out into the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. Royal sees Richie standing in front of the elevator. Roya looks surprised. The doors of another elevator open. Pago is the operator. Richie looks at him. Pagoda hesitates. H waves to Richie. Richie waves back. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) Going up? Richie looks back to Royal. He nods. He steps into Royalв elevator. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) What floor?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: It doesnвЂ™t matter. Royal closes the doors and pulls a lever. The elevator go up. Royal stands with his back to Richie. RICHIE (CONTвЂ™D) So youвЂ™re elevator operators now.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Yeah. We just started, but weвЂ™ll get a bump when we join the union. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: What made you decide to do that?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Well, weвЂ™re broke. But, in answer to your question, I guess IвЂ™m trying to prove I can pay my dues and what-not. I just hope somebody knows. Richie nods. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: You asked me why I choked out there that day. Royal turns around quickly and looks to Richie. He nods. RICHIE (CONTвЂ™D) Well, I think I know the answer, and I wanted your advice. Royal looks surprised and moved. He says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Sure. EXT. ROOF. DAY. Royal and Richie stand on the edge of the roof, looking o at the city. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Margot Tenenbaum?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Since always.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Does she know?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: And whatвЂ™s her feeling about it?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I think she feels confused. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I can understand that. ItвЂ™s probably illegal.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t think so. WeвЂ™re not related by blood.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (pause) ThatвЂ™s true. Silence. Royal nods. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) ItвЂ™s still frowned upon, but then what isnвЂ™t these days, right? Richie nods. Royal shrugs. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) I donвЂ™t know. Maybe it works. Why not? Hell, you love each other, and nobody knows whatвЂ™s going to happen, so -- Royal stops short. His expression changes. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) You know what? DonвЂ™t listen to me. I never understood her, myself. I never understood any of us. I wish I knew what to tell you, but I just donвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (pause) ThatвЂ™s OK.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: No, itвЂ™s not. Royal looks very sad. He stares down at the ground. He takes a deep breath. He says quietly: ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) Do you still consider me your father?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Sure, I do.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I wish I had a little more to offer in that department.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I know you do, Pop. Royal nods. He keeps looking down at the ground. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t blame you, by the way. Richie looks off into the distance. He frowns. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) SheвЂ™s a great looking girl, and sheвЂ™s smart as a whip, and --

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Mordecai? Royal looks up. A falcon flies in a low circle around the building. Royal and Richie watch as it lands on the raili in front of them. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Richie slowly reaches out to the falcon. He smooths out t feathers on its neck and says softly:

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: You came back. Royal looks up at the sky. He seems frightened.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Jiminy Cricket. He must have a goddamn radar in his brain. Richie frowns. He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not so sure this is Mordecai.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: What do you mean? He flew right in here.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but now he has white feathers on his neck. Royal and Richie study the falcon. Richie seems uncertain

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Well, the son of a bitch must be molting. INT. ELEVATOR. DAY. Richie and Royal ride down in the elevator. The falcon is perched on RichieвЂ™s arm.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I need your help with something else. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (excitedly) You got it. WhatвЂ™s the situation?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Well, I think --

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Hang on. Royal throws the lever on the elevator to full speed. It accelerates and starts shaking violently. He yells into a walkie-talkie: ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) Pagoda! LetвЂ™s hit it!

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (hesitates) I didnвЂ™t mean right this second. INT. ELIвЂ™S STUDY. DAY. Eli sits on the couch in his study working on a jigsaw pu of the Beatles crossing Abbey Road. Three Egyptian men ar chopping up yellow powder on the table. Electronic music blasts form the stereo. There is a knock on the door. Everyone looks up. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Yes? The door opens and Richie looks inside. Eli and the Egypt men stare at Richie. Eli has yellow powder on his nose. H says awkwardly: ELI (CONTвЂ™D) Hey, Richie. Richie walks into the room. Royal and Pagoda follow him. They are dressed in their elevator-operator uniforms. Eli looks confused and uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: We want to take you to get some help.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (pause) Is it just you guys? Richie looks slightly confused. ELI (CONTвЂ™D) I guess Margot and your mother couldnвЂ™t make it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Eli looks disappointed. He sees the bandages around Richi arms. ELI (CONTвЂ™D) What happened there?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Nothing. Royal looks to the Egyptian men.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Would you excuse us, please? The Egyptian men hesitate. Pagoda points to the door. The Egyptian men leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: WhereвЂ™s Sabrina?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (pause) They went back to England. Richie nods. He sits down next to Eli. Royal and Pagoda s across from them.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Are we still friends? Eli seems embarrassed and hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Are we?

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Of course. I canвЂ™t believe you would ask me that.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: It doesnвЂ™t matter. I heard about you and Margot. Silence. Eli gets up and goes over to the window. He look out at the backyard. Richie goes over and stands next to him. Eli looks deeply depressed.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry. I donвЂ™t know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t have to say anything. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: I always wanted to be a Tenenbaum, you know? Richie nods. Eli looks to Royal. Royal nods and says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Me, too. Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: But it doesnвЂ™t mean what it used to, does it? Richie shakes his head. Eli opens the window, reaches out and picks a dead leaf off a branch of a tree. He looks to Richie. ELI (CONTвЂ™D) I wish youвЂ™dвЂ™ve done this for me when I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: (pause) But you didnвЂ™t have a drug problem then.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it still wouldвЂ™ve meant a lot to me. Anyway, I really appreciate your coming over here now. I do recognize that I have a problem, and I want to get better. Let me just get my things. Eli goes into the bathroom and locks the door. Pagoda goe over to the window and looks out. He sees Eli running down the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: PAGODA
dialogues.text: There he goes. Royal and Richie rush over to the window. They watch Eli drop to the ground, run into the street, and hail a taxi. has on socks but no shoes. INT. ICE-CREAM PARLOR. DAY. A room decorated like a birthday cake. Every booth is fil with divorced fathers and their young daughters. Margot s across from Royal. Royal is dressed in his elevator-opera uniform. A waiter stands next to him.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I want to order some ice cream for my daughter, please. What would you like, Margot? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: I told you. Nothing. I only have five minutes. Royal looks frustrated. Margot sighs.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: IвЂ™1l have a butterscotch sundae, I guess. The waiter nods and walks away. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Your brotherвЂ™s all torn up inside.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Well, so am I, but IвЂ™m not going to discuss it with you. Royal sighs. He leans across the table and says urgently:

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: CanвЂ™t someone be a shit their whole life and want to repair the damage? I mean, I think people want to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Do they? Royal nods. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You probably donвЂ™t even know my middle name.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (pause) ItвЂ™s a trick question. You donвЂ™t have one.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Helen.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (surprised) That was my motherвЂ™s name.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: (sadly) I know it was. EXT. SIDEWALK. DAY. Royal stands on the sidewalk in front of the Tenenbaum ho He has a bunch of white flowers in his hand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Anwar is asleep in the BMW parked at the curb. Royal thro a pebble at a window on the third floor. Ari looks out the window. Royal smiles. Ari opens the window. Uzi appears beside him. Royal calls up to them:

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Anybody feel like grabbing a couple of burgers and hitting the cemetery? Chas appears between Ari and Uzi. He looks down to Royal. Royal looks nervous. Chas closes the window.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Royal putting his bunch of flowers on RachaelвЂ™s grave. stands alone with his hands in his pockets. He walks away EXT. STREET. DAY. Etheline and Henry come down the front steps of HenryвЂ™s building. They both look depressed. Royal is waiting at t bus stop on the corner, next to a small Mexican man ina windbreaker and a tie. Royal has a large envelope in his hands. Etheline and Henry see him. Royal goes over to the

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I got you something, Ethel. Actually, I made it. Etheline and Henry look at Royal warily. Royal hands Etheline the envelope. She looks to Henry. Henry shrugs. She opens the envelope. It contains a sheaf of typwritten documents.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s this?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: A divorce. Etheline looks to Royal. She says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: From you?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Yes. Royal looks to Henry. Henry does not know what to say. Royal motions to the Mexican man. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) This is Sanchez. HeвЂ™s a notary public.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Hello. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Hello, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: If youвЂ™1l just sign here, please, Ethel. Royal hands Etheline a pen and points to a dotted line. Etheline signs. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) And here. Etheline signs. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) And initial here. Etheline signs. Royal hands the sheaf of documents to Sanchez. Sanchez puts several stamps and notations on it. Royal looks up at HenryвЂ™s building. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) You own this building, donвЂ™t you, Henry? ItвЂ™s magnificent. I used to be a home- owner myself, but my son expropriated it from me. Henry does not respond. A city bus approaches from the ne block. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) Here comes my bus. Thanks, Sanchez.

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™ re welcome.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Are we divorced?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Almost. Sanchez just has to file the papers. Royal signals to the bus driver. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) I love you, Etheline. And congratulations, both of you. Royal looks to Henry. He turns back to Etheline. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) I didnвЂ™t think so much of him at first, but now I get it. HeвЂ™s everything IвЂ™m not. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Royal smiles. He turns away suddenly, runs to the bus, an jumps inside. He looks back to Etheline. He yells: ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) Take back Pagoda, will you? Etheline hesitates. She nods. The door closes. Etheline and Henry stand watching with Sanchez. INT. ELIвЂ™S CAR. NIGHT. Eli drives through a tunnel at top speed in the middle of night. He has on sunglasses, and he is covered with grass and dirt. Electronic music blasts from the stereo. He loo lost and sad.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Page 258. It says вЂњChapter Nine.вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An invitation to EthelineвЂ™s and HenryвЂ™s wedding at th on Archer Avenue. It is nearly identical to the invitatio on the cover of the first edition of The Royal Tenenbaums EXT. STREET. DAY. Ari, Uzi and Pagoda stand in front of the house with Buck receiving the wedding guests. They help people out of the cars, give them programs for the ceremony, and direct the the front door. There are about fifty guests. Half of them are black and half are white. The members of the wedding party are dres in morning suits. Royal and Dusty get out of a gypsy cab. Royal smiles at A and Uzi. He hugs Pagoda and kisses Ari and Uzi on the top of their heads. He looks around. He whispers:

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I got you some jawbreakers. Royal slips Ari and Uzi each a large purple-and-green-str jawbreaker. They hide them in their jackets. INT. CHASвЂ™ BEDROOM. DAY. A twenty-one-year-old black Navy midshipman helps Henry finish tying his bow tie. The midshipman is Walter. Henry studies his tie in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s slightly uneven. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Henry unties his knot and starts from scratch. Richie cra open the door and looks into the room.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
