dialogues.text: Henry? Henry looks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Hello, Richie. This is my son, Walter Sherman. Richie comes into the room. He and Walter shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Walter.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: HenryвЂ™s your dad? Chas is standing in the doorway. Walter hesitates. He nod Chas looks to Henry. CHAS (CONTвЂ™D) So youвЂ™ve been married before?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes. IвЂ™m a widower.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. I forgot. (pause) You know, IвЂ™m a widower myself.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I know you are, Chas. INT. MARGOTвЂ™S BEDROOM. DAY. Margot looks out the window at the guests arriving on the street while Etheline finishes her make-up. Margot has a white plastic inhaler in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: What are you chewing on?

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: My nicotine inhaler. ItвЂ™s supposed to help me quit.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Is it working? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Not really. EXT. STREET. DAY. Ari and Uzi tie BuckleyвЂ™s leash around a pole in front house. Royal and a very small Irish priest stand together the top of the steps.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Well, of course, IвЂ™m half Hebrew, but the children are three-quarters Mick- Catholic.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: (nods) So they were raised in the church.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (pause) I believe so. I really donвЂ™t know. A carвЂ™s tires squeal around the corner. Royal and the p look down the block. EliвЂ™s convertible skids through th turn on to Archer Avenue. Royal and the priest frown. INT. ELIвЂ™S CAR. DAY. EliвЂ™s face is covered with Apache warpaint. He is dress a morning suit. He wears a distracted smile. He downshift accelerates, and steers toward the Tenenbaum house. He whispers:

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Here I come.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ari, Uzi and Buckley watching frozen as EliвЂ™s car races toward them. Royal looks panicked. He looks to Ari and Uz and hollers:

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Boys! Royal jumps down the stairs. INT. MARGOTвЂ™S BEDROOM. DAY. There is a tremendous crashing boom and the sound of shattering glass. Etheline rushes over next to Margot at window.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: What was that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Eli just crashed his car into the front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. INT. STAIRWELL. DAY. Chas sprints down the stairs three at a time. He falls an bangs against the wall. He gets back up and keeps running INT. LIVING ROOM. DAY. Eli sits on the floor, barefoot, covered in glass and deb He is bleeding from a head wound. Three dalmation mice da around the room in confusion. Several guests help Eli stagger to his feet. They look alarmed at his appearance, particularly the warpaint.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Where are my shoes? Dudley finds one of EliвЂ™s shoes in the fireplace. He ha it to Eli. Eli puts it on. EXT. SIDEWALK. DAY. The wedding guests quickly begin to come out the front do and gather around the smashed car. There is also a crushe mailbox, and mail is scattered all over the sidewalk. The lighter airmail envelopes drift about in the wind. Chas r down the steps. He yells:

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Where are you? Royal and Richie stand up among the rubble. Royal holds A under one arm and Uzi under the other. He sets them down. Chas runs over to them.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: TheyвЂ™ re OK, Chas. Chas grabs Ari and Uzi. He examines them. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) ItвЂ™s OK. TheyвЂ™re safe.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: Dad, they ran over Buckley.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Chas looks to Royal. Royal nods. He turns to the wreckage BuckleyвЂ™s leash remains tied to the railing and extends beneath the wheels of EliвЂ™s car.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I think we lost Buckley. Ari and Uzi start to cry. Richie brushes some debris off UziвЂ™s hair. He looks to Chas and points to Royal.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: He saved them. Kind of. Chas looks to Richie. He says blankly:

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: He did? Richie nods. Chas looks to Royal. Royal shrugs. Eli appears in the broken front window of the home.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Did I hit anybody? Everyone looks to Eli. ELI (CONTвЂ™D) Is everybody okay? Eli sees Chas staring at him. Eli hesitates. He darts awa from the window. Chas bolts up the steps, banging his way through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Chas! Wait! INT. HALLWAY. DAY. Chas bursts into the house. He screams:

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Eli! The guests panic as Eli jumps over a couch, knocks over a chair, and ducks into the kitchen. INT. KITCHEN. DAY. Pagoda looks up from a tray of canapes he is preparing. H does not appear to notice EliвЂ™s strange appearance and injuries. He holds one of the canapes to him.

dialogues.speaker: PAGODA
dialogues.text: This is the quailвЂ™s egg. Eli takes it quickly. Chas smashes open the door. Eli bod checks him and breaks out of the room. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slam past the priest and knock him down the basement stairs. The wedding guests scream and yell and try to bre it up or get away. Eli slips out the back door and sprints into the garden. EXT. BACKYARD. DAY. Eli runs to the back wall and tries the gate. It is locke Chas tackles him hard. Chas grabs him by the arm, swings around, and slams him against the wall. Eli yells. People rush into the backyard. Richie runs outside.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Chas! DonвЂ™t! Richie tries to pull Chas off Eli. Chas elbows Richie in face. Richie falls backwards into the bushes. Chas picks Eli and tries to throw him over the wall. Eli scratches a clutches.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Help! Please! Chas yells insanely. He throws Eli over the wall. He turn to everyone watching him. They look stunned. Chas breathe heavily. Richie sits up in the bushes. He has his hand ov his eye.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Chas? Chas hesitates. He climbs over the wall. EXT. NEIGHBORвЂ™S YARD. DAY. Chas lands in a Zen garden, next to Eli. Eli is stretched out on his back. He and Chas look at each other. Chas lie down on the ground. He seems drained. It is very quiet. They both stare up at the sky. There are bonsai trees all around them.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: Did I hit the dog?

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (pause) Is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (pause) I need help. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: So do I. Walter looks over the top of the wall, down at Chas and E He looks back behind him and yells to someone:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Go around to the other side! EXT. EMBASSY. DAY. Henry and Royal run around the corner and up the steps of neighborвЂ™s house. A plaque next to the front door says вЂњResidence of the Japanese Ambassador.вЂќ Royal knocks. wait. Royal looks to Henry. He says suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Can I say something to you, Henry? Henry looks to Royal. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) IвЂ™ve been considered an asshole for about as long as I can remember. ThatвЂ™s just my style. But IвЂ™d feel pretty blue if I didnвЂ™t think you were going to forgive me. Henry nods. He says gently:

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t think youвЂ™re an asshole, Royal. YouвЂ™re just a kind of a son of a bitch. Royal seems genuinely moved by this remark.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: Well, I appreciate that. The door opens. A small Asian woman in a kimono looks out them. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) Can we get into your backyard, maвЂ™ am? We got a couple of boys out there. EXT. SIDEWALK. DAY. There are two police cars, an ambulance, a tow-truck and fire engine in front of the house. Raleigh and two paramedics roll the priest on a gurney. Raleigh holds the priestвЂ™s hand.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: I think he mayвЂ™ve broken his ankle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s not terribly serious, is it? (to the priest) Do you have an alternative? The priest shakes his head. Eli is being questioned by a police officer. His warpaint smeared, and there are several bandages on his head and a He looks very upset.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: At which point I apparently lost control of the vehicle, smashed it into the house, and killed that poor dog. The police officer studies EliвЂ™s driverвЂ™s license.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re Eli Cash.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (pause) I am, indeed.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OFFICER
dialogues.text: I love your work.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: (touched) How sweet of you to say so. Royal stands among a group of firemen with a dalmation.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I think heвЂ™s part mutt. What kind of papers you got for him? One of the firemen shrugs. Royal points at the dalmation. ROYAL (CONTвЂ™D) Sparkplug. Sit. The dalmation sits. Royal looks impressed. Dusty stands with Richie on the sidewalk and examines his eye. It is scratched badly and looks terrible.

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Can you see out of it? Richie covers his good eye to test his bad eye.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Not really. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DUSTY
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Minor corneal damage. Page me if it spreads to the other eye. Raleigh and Dudley stand next to each other wearing firem helmets. Dudley laughs crazily.

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s so funny, Dudley?

dialogues.speaker: DUDLEY
dialogues.text: You look great! Henry and Walter survey the scene from the smashed-out li room window. Walter points to the rubble.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: But these arenвЂ™t structure-bearing elements, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: It doesnвЂ™t matter. ItвЂ™s still best to file under force majeure and recoup the deductible. Ari and Uzi try to look at Buckley under EliвЂ™s car as s firemen and tow-truck drivers attach straps and chains to wheels and axle. Etheline goes over to them.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: You boys come over here with me.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: But BuckleyвЂ™s still under there.

dialogues.speaker: ETHELINE
dialogues.text: I know, but thereвЂ™s nothing we can do for him, at the moment. Royal takes the dalmation over to Chas.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I got you a new dog for the boys. Chas looks at the dalmation. He looks back to Royal.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s this?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I just bought him.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: You did? Royal nods. Silence. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry I let you down, Chas. All of you. IвЂ™ve been trying to make it up to you. Royal holds out the leash. Chas hesitates. He takes it.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s his name?

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: (quietly) Sparkplug.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™ re welcome. Chas suddenly starts crying. He stares at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CHAS
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™ve had a rough year, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: I know you have, Chassie. Royal puts his hand on ChasвЂ™ head. Chas looks to Royal takes a deep breath. He nods. Royal watches as Chas takes the dalmation over to Ari and Uzi and talks to them quiet for a minute. Uzi pets the dalmation. Ari takes the leash. Etheline loo to Royal. Royal looks back at her. Etheline smiles sadly. EXT. ROOF. DAY. Richie and Margot sit near the edge of the roof, next to falcon in its coop. Richie has an ice pack over his eye. brushes his hand against the white feathers on the falcon neck.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: I wonder what happened to him.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know. (pause) Sometimes when people have a traumatic experience, their hair turns white. Silence. Margot says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: Well, IвЂ™m sure heвЂ™1l get over it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Richie nods. Margot looks at him for a minute. She takes her inhaler out of her mouth and puts it in her pocket. S turns and looks at the top of the chimney. She pulls out loose brick. She reaches behind it and takes out a pack o cigarettes and a matchbook. She looks to Richie. She poin at the chimney.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This was one of my first hiding places. Richie studies the pack of cigarettes. It is still sealed but the wrapper has faded.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: How old you think those are? Margot opens the pack, takes out a cigarette, puts it in mouth, and lights it. She takes a puff.

dialogues.speaker: MARGOT
dialogues.text: IвЂ™d say about ten years. Richie nods. Margot offers him a cigarette. He takes it, and she lights it. Margot puts her arm around RichieвЂ™s shoulder, and they smoke their stale cigarettes together. EXT. GARDEN. DAY. Ari, Uzi and Chas watch Royal throw dirt on to a grave in backyard. They have tears in their eyes. The dalmation si on the ground next to them.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Royal dug a hole for Buckley behind the garden shed, and buried him in a canvas duffle bag. Chas hands Royal a bottle of scotch, and Royal takes a dr

dialogues.speaker: ROYAL
dialogues.text: All right, boys. Say a prayer -- Ari begins, with a jawbreaker in his mouth:

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: Dear Heavenly Father -- INT. OFFICE. DAY. Henry and Etheline stand side by side in front of a judge a small office with green carpet and an exercise bicycle. Henry has his left hand raised and his right hand on a bi

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: So help me God. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The judge extends the Bible to Etheline. She puts her han on it.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Etheline and Henry were married forty- eight hours later, in judgeвЂ™s chambers. INT. THEATRE. NIGHT. A stage-set for a play that appears to take place ina network of tree houses on a tropical island. A father introduces his daughter to a group of native tribesmen.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: This is my adopted daughter, Elaine Levinson. The house is sold out. Royal sits in the front row with t other Tenenbaums. He laughs quietly and shakes his head. The rest of the audience is silent.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: MargotвЂ™s new play, The Levinsons in the Trees, was produced at the Cavendish Theatre.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Margot standing alone outside the theatre, under the marq smoking a cigarette. NARRATOR (CONTвЂ™D) It ran for just under two weeks and received mixed reviews. INT. AUDITORIUM. DAY. Brooks College. Raleigh and Dudley sit onstage at a table front of an audience of doctors and medical students. Raleigh takes a question.

dialogues.speaker: MEDICAL STUDENT
dialogues.text: Can he tell time?

dialogues.speaker: RALEIGH
dialogues.text: Oh, my Lord, no. Dudley shakes his head emphatically.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Raleigh and Dudley went on a lecture tour to eleven universities in the promotion of their new book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A copy of RaleighвЂ™s new book, DudleyвЂ™s World. On the jacket there is a yearbook photograph of Dudley with his Henry Aaron-style glasses flipped up. His expression is almost impossibly blank. EXT. HOSPITAL. DAY. A resort compound on the high plains. Eli practices with lasso in front of several young addicts. He has stitches his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Eli checked himself into a rehabilitation hospital in North Dakota. A tall, skinny, Native American man in his late forties w over to Eli. He and Eli are dressed in matching deerskin jackets. Eli points to him.

dialogues.speaker: ELI
dialogues.text: This is my sponsor, Runs with Two Horses. INT. 375TH STREET Y ROOFTOP. DAY. A concrete tennis court with a chain-link net. Ari, Uzi a a group of children dressed in tennis clothes watch as Ri demonstrates the continental style of grip to them. Richi has a white gauze patch taped over his eye.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE
dialogues.text: Rod Laver used it. You know who Laver is? Uzi steps up to the service line. He bounces a ball and g ready to serve.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Richie started a programme teaching competitive tennis to eight- to twelve- year-olds at the 375th Street Y. Uzi hits a fast serve to RichieвЂ™s forehand. Richie fire return full-speed straight down the line. Uzi watches it race past him. EXT. STREET. DAY. Royal, Chas, Ari and Uzi ride on the back of a speeding garbage truck. They are all laughing.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Royal had a heart attack at the age of sixty-eight.  119. INT. AMBULANCE. DAY. Royal is strapped on to a gurney with tubes sticking out his arms and an oxygen mask on his face. Chas sits beside him, holding his hand. The ambulance races full-speed up wrong side of the street.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Chas rode with him in the ambulance, and was the only witness to his fatherвЂ™s death. Royal appears to be smiling underneath his oxygen mask. H looks up at Chas. Chas puts his hand on RoyalвЂ™s cheek. Royal closes his eyes. NARRATOR (CONTвЂ™D) In his will, he stipulated that his funeral take place at dusk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 275 of The Royal Tenenbaums. It says вЂњEpilogue.вЂќ EXT. CEMETERY. DAY. Snow falls lightly, and the sky is getting dark. Everyone the family is gathered around as Chas, Richie, Henry, Raleigh, Eli, Dusty and Pagoda lower the casket. They are all bundled up in coats and scarves. They step away from grave. Henry stands next to Etheline. She takes his arm. Pagoda wears RoyalвЂ™s sunglasses. Tears stream down his face. D stands beside him. Margot has her arm around RichieвЂ™s shoulder. She smokes a cigarette. Raleigh stands next to Dudley. Eli stands next to Walter. The priest is on crutches. Chas looks to Ari and Uzi standing a few yards away. He nods. Ari and Uzi fire several shots into the air with Ch and RoyalвЂ™s old BB guns. RoyalвЂ™s gravestone sits in a wheelbarrow next to a pile dirt. It reads вЂњRoyal OвЂ™Reilly Tenenbaum (1932-2001) Epitaph: вЂњDied tragically rescuing his family from the wreckage of a destroyed sinking battleship.вЂќ The priest this and hesitates. He looks puzzled. He smiles slightly. Richie throws a white flower into the grave. They all sta in silence for a minute before they turn away and walk to their waiting car.
